context: <a0_0>In Texas, <b4_0>English<b4_0/> is the state's de facto official language<a0_0/> (though it lacks de jure status) and is used in government. However<a1_0>, <b5_0>the <b8_0>continual influx of Spanish-speaking immigrants<b8_0/> increased the import of Spanish in Texas<b5_0/>.<a1_0/> Texas's counties bordering Mexico are mostly <b7_0>Hispanic<b7_0/>, and consequently, Spanish is commonly spoken in the region<a2_0>. <b6_0>The Government of Texas, through Section 2054.116 of the Government Code, mandates that state agencies provide information on their <a3_0>websites in Spanish<b6_0/><a2_0/> to assist residents who have limited English proficiency.
